message.content:
cs.FL, cs.LO, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.PL 

The paper deals with functional weighted automata and their properties, which are relevant to formal language theory and automata theory. The most relevant sub-category is cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory). The paper also involves decision problems, which are related to computational complexity and logic, suggesting that it could also belong to cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science). The paper also discusses discounted sum automata, which are relevant to optimization and decision-making, indicating that it could belong to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The paper also involves the use of automata for modeling and analysis, which could suggest that it belongs to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper discusses determinization of automata, which is relevant to programming languages and compilers, indicating that it could also belong to cs.PL (Programming Languages).
